company_name: Southeast Asia Commercial Joint Stock Bank
company_profile: Southeast Asia Commercial Joint Stock Bank (SSB) was established in 1994. The Bank has its business in capital mobilization, credit grants and relevant financial services. SSB has been listed on Hochiminh Stock Exchange (HOSE) since December 2020. In 2024, compared to the same period, The net interest margin (NIM) stood at 3.48%, reflecting an increase of 0.5%. The non-performing loan ratio was at 1.89%, decreasing of 0.05%. The coverage ratio for non-performing loans (NPL) was at 82.88%, decreasing of 2.62%. the net profit after tax of the parent company is valued at VND4.8 trillion, increased 30.98%. The return on equity (ROE) was at 14.75%, up 1.74%. SSB has been listed on Hochiminh Stock Exchange (HOSE) since December 2020.
history_dev: March 25, 1994: Southeast Asia Commercial Joint Stock Bank was established under Licence No.0051/NH-GP issued by the State Bank of Vietnam; 2012: Increased the charter capital to VND5,335 billion; 2013: Increased the charter capital to VND5,465 billion; December 2018: Increased the charter capital to VND7,688 billion; September 2019: Increased the charter capital to VND9,369 billion; October 2020: Increased the charter capital to VND12,088 billion; December 30, 2020: Listed on Hochiminh Stock Exchange (HOSE); March 24, 2021: Traded on Hochiminh Stock Exchange (HOSE); September 22, 2021: Increased the charter capital to VND13.424 billion; December 24, 2021: Increased the charter capital to VND14.784 billion; April 20, 2022: Increased charter capital VND16.598 billion; August 15, 2022: Increased charter capital to VND 19,808.9 billion; February 8, 2023:  Increased charter capital to VND 20,402.9 billion; July 24, 2023: Increased charter capital to VND24,537 billion; May 21, 2024: Increased charter capital to VND24,957 billion;
key_developments: Credit granting; Financial services: mobilization, credits, foreign exchange businesses, international trade finance.
business_strategies: To become a dynamic and multifunctional retail bank closely aligned with international management standards; To build an advanced digital platform to improve products and services, optimize processes, enhance customer experience, and simplify financial management; To serve customers to the fullest through multi-channel access, a diverse range of products and services, and the implementation of comprehensive financial solutions and personalized services tailored to customer segments.
